definition: not saying anything further (idiom); not raising any objection/without demur
two/2/(Beijing dialect) stupid
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
(negative prefix)/not/no
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: Without saying a word, the militiamen shot and killed him.
sentences.chinese: 民兵們二話不說，開槍把他打死了。

sentences.english: Two guys two words don't say of pull me to go toward to drill in forest.
sentences.chinese: 兩個傢伙二話不說的拉着我就往森林裏鑽。

sentences.english: But the police just came through the gate and did this.
sentences.chinese: 但那時那些警察就是二話不說衝進來，翻箱倒櫃。

sentences.english: Suddenly, without another word, he unlocked my cell and silently led me out.
sentences.chinese: 突然，他二話不說地打開牢門，安靜地領着我向外走。

sentences.english: Without a word, the demons did exactly as the king had asked.
sentences.chinese: 兩個魔鬼二話不說就照大仁慈王的要求去做了。

sentences.english: The lawyer, without a word, wrote the butcher a check for $9.80.
sentences.chinese: 律師二話不說，給屠夫寫了張9塊8的支票。

sentences.english: Coach a laugh, and the word, you pull me up.
sentences.chinese: 教練一笑，二話不說，就把我拉了起來。

sentences.english: I went to a freak show and they let me in for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 我去看一場怪誕秀，他們二話不說就讓我進去了。

sentences.english: When they saw me they didn't say anything, then when they came near to me they started to beat me.
sentences.chinese: 他們看到我之後二話不說就開始走近我打我。

definition: at once/immediately/promptly/swiftly
hurriedly/without delay
promptly/at once
at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
fortunately/luckily
easily/without trouble/while one is at it/in passing/handy
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
just now/a moment ago
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
right away/quickly/immediately
to come up/to approach/(verb complement indicating success)
to interrupt/to break off/to break (a bone)
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
slip of paper
see 過來|过来[guo4 lai2]
to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of
